p:
Where the parameters including β, φ, α, γ, θ, and η were the rate at which infectious contact occur, probability that the infectious contact result in successful infection, rate of exposed individuals becoming infectious, rate of infectious individuals becoming recovered, proportion of newly exposed individuals were quarantined, and rate of quarantine release, respectively. The basic reproductive number (
R 0
) and the rate at which infectious contact occur were assumed to be 2.68, and 9.1 × 10 −8 based on the
R 0
, α, φ, and the population size in Seoul (9.74 million) [ 6, 7, 8, 9]. We assumed the model parameters as: φ = 0.4 [ 8], α −1 = 6.5 days [ 7], γ − 1 = 3.5 days [ 10], and η − 1 = 0.07. The additional pre-infection seeding ( i) as the international students from China would be influx into the exposed class.
